website_summaries.verdict: The BabyBjorn cradle is a soft, comfortable, and safe place for your baby to sleep. Your infant will be comforted by the gentle rocking motions of the cradle, and you can easily move this lightweight design from room to room.
pros: The breathable mesh material provides superior airflow
The low height allows you to check on your baby with ease
The cradle fabric and waterproof mattress cover are removable and machine washable for easy cleaning
Slight transparency of the material allows you to see your baby even if you're not right there
cons: Some have said the cradle gets too jumpy when the baby moves around

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this while pregnant and now that my little one is here I am happy to say I love it. My baby enjoys it and sleeps well. I didn’t want to buy the fitted crib sheets that match the mattress because they’re too expensive so I bought regular oval sheets from babies r us and they work just fine👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: Sara Varvara

customer_reviews.title: Perfect but small
customer_reviews.text: I would give this cradle five stars if it were bigger. It's simple, stylish and very safe (highest rating on several baby gear sites). It's a breeze to install, too. And here's the but: Even though the cradle is for the first six months or so I can't imagine that my baby will fit in it much longer than three months. At not even a month old he's already only a few inches from the walls at each end. I would buy this cradle again and recommend it, but I really wish it were bigger.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and solid

customer_reviews.title: ... 3 1/2 weeks old now and has been sleeping like a champ in this bassinet
customer_reviews.text: My newborn is 3 1/2 weeks old now and has been sleeping like a champ in this bassinet. It was important to me to follow the AAP recommendation to have our baby sleep flat on his back, rather than in a rock n play or swing like a lot of our friends have done. The all-mesh sides make a huge difference, there are times when he wiggles himself to the edge of the mattress but because he can still get plenty of air no matter where he is in the cradle I feel comfortable keeping him in it. Not cheap, but in this case you get what you pay for.

customer_reviews.text: The cradle is very nice. The materials are high quality, the fabrics are soft. There was a large "hazard of sufication" notice prominently stitched on the side rail that my pregnant daughter requested I remove.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cradle
customer_reviews.text: My daughter and son-in-law say this cradle is awesome. Easy to assemble, aesthetically pleasing, and my daughter says it is lightweight and easy to move from room to room.
customer_reviews.author: Robbin L. Stoddard

customer_reviews.title: Very cute cradle and the best made thing we could find
customer_reviews.text: Very cute cradle and the best made thing we could find. It's amazing that even though a company puts so much effort into the quality of textiles and manufacturing and certifications that they stlll use MDF with formaldehyde... but this was the least evil thing on the market that fit where we needed it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Cradle
customer_reviews.text: Unlike the ugly 1980's bassinets this is a nice small modern design that is light and can be moved around the house with great ease even in my postpartum state. I recommend this cradle it is worth the price. However you should shop around for another brand sheet.
customer_reviews.author: Danii Oliver

customer_reviews.title: High quality product but too expensive using it for only 6 months
customer_reviews.text: The product design is beautiful, easy to assembly and wash as you use. My baby seems not enjoying the rocking motion because she often startled - she probably needs something firm rather than rocking. In addition, it is very expensive given you can only use it for 6 months as your baby quickly outgrows the cradle by month 5.
customer_reviews.author: Van Ho

customer_reviews.title: Baby doesn't like it's.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this but my baby just doesn't like to sleep in it for long. It's very lightweight and can be moved around easily but just not as comfy as the pack n play. The mattress is kind of hard.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Jordan

customer_reviews.title: We wanted to like it, we really really wanted to like it
customer_reviews.text: We wanted to like it, we really really wanted to like it. The reviews are all so great. But the baby hates it, we hate it. It's too low on the ground for us to pick him up easily from the bed. It's a really beautiful piece of furniture though, but it's gathering dust in our living room.
customer_reviews.author: N V

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, price of canopy a bit much.
customer_reviews.text: Still waiting for baby but meet all expectations, good size, easy to move, looks great. Now want canopy but feel it is too expensive. Really easy to put together and not concerned about its size.
customer_reviews.author: Bex

customer_reviews.title: Misleading and shameful that the pictures to do not come ...
customer_reviews.text: Misleading and shameful that the pictures to do not come with the very ugly, disturbing SUFFOCATION HAZARD warnings sewn all over. Please let me know if there is a way to remove them - else this will have to be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amir

customer_reviews.title: Textiles Made in China
customer_reviews.text: I feel like I got duped, and I'm not happy about it. I was willing to spend the extra money for this bassinet based on its design and the fact that unlike 99.9% of baby items, it was made in Europe. I got it, and set it up, and loved it. Today, I wanted to wash the textile portion to prepare for baby's arrival next week, and upon disassembling it, found the 'textiles made in China' tag. That is false advertising, and not what I wanted to spend my money on. So disappointed in this, and Baby Bjorn for falsely representing their product.
customer_reviews.author: KJ23

customer_reviews.title: 100% polyurethane foam
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bassinet trusting the reputation of Baby Bjorn. When I opened the bassinet and attempted to put it together, I noticed the mattress pad is 100% polyurethane foam which has been identified as containing toxic substances. Baby Bjorn states their products do not contain flame retardants; however there are other chemicals present in the foam. Also, the board beneath the mattress is MDF board which contains formaldehyde. I want the safest option for my baby so I returned this item.
customer_reviews.author: michiemay

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, but not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: My baby HATED this bassinet. It is beautiful and modern- but baby woke herself up in it every five seconds. We wish we could return it, especially since we spent so much on it, but with Amazon's return policy of 90 days we can't. I would not buy it until after baby is born so you are able to return it if they don't like it. It also doesn't "rock" as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline

product_meta.title: BABYBJORN Cradle - White
product_meta.description:
Size:1 CountCradle with gentle, soothing rocking
A compact cradle where your newborn can sleep peacefully! The baby cradle’s gentle springy rocking is similar to the soothing motion of a stroller. A perfect place to sleep in the early months when your baby takes short, frequent naps. The cradle’s low height and transparent mesh fabric also give you a reassuring degree of supervision over your baby. Suitable for babies from approx. 0–6 months (max. weight 18 lbs/8 kg). Durable 

Features and benefits
Rock gently and sleep peacefully
The cradle’s gentle springy rocking is similar to the soothing motion of a stroller. You can easily rock the cradle with your hand or foot, and it also turns your baby’s own movements into gentle rocking.
Airy mesh fabric for cool and safe sleep
The sides of the cradle are made from a soft, airy mesh fabric that allows your baby to breathe freely, even if their face gets very close to the side of the cradle. It also allows good supervision of your baby in the cradle.
Easy to move around
The cradle is compact and lightweight, so it’s easy for you to move around your home and keep your baby close.
Firmly in place on the floor
Despite its compact design, the cradle is very stable and has sturdy non-slip feet that keep it firmly in place on the floor.
Easy to fold up
When you fold up the cradle, it only measures 5 in/13 cm in height.
Washable mattress
The cradle’s mattress is machine washable on hot (60°C).
Product facts

Age
For newborns to approx. 6 months (max. 18 lbs/8 kg). You can use the cradle until your baby weighs 18 lbs/8 kg or can sit up, kneel or stand unaided.
Weight and dimensions 
Cradle weight: 13 lbs/6 kg
Mattress: 14 x 28 in/36 x 72 cm
Assembled: 23 x 31 x 26 in/58 x 79 x 65 cm
Folded up: 23 x 31 x 5 in/58 x 79 x 13 cm
A fitted mattress is included.
Materials
Cradle sides: 100% polyester
Cradle base: MDF, Class 2
Cradle legs: beechwood 
Mattress: 100% polyester
Mattress cover: 100% cotton
Tested and safe 
The cradle is tested and approved in accordance with the safety requirements in EN 1130 Furniture – Cribs and cradles for domestic use.
Product care 
Machine wash the mattress and the mattress cover on hot (60°C). The mesh fabric sides are machine washable on warm (40°C). We recommend that you use a mild and bleach-free detergent. Do not tumble dry.

BABYBJÖRN
Buying a cradle from BABYBJÖRN

A place for your baby to sleep should be designed with safety in mind and made using child-friendly materials. When you buy a cradle from BABYBJÖRN, you can be confident that the materials do not contain any harmful or allergenic substances and that the construction is sturdy and durable.
